It is characterized by its delicate, thread-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream edges. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its unique appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Chytraculia scoparia is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
